title: Channel Fear and Anxiety Productively
brief: Transform natural fear and anxiety responses into focused survival actions rather than paralysis.
steps: Acknowledge that fear is a normal response to dangerous survival situations.
Use fear to increase caution in situations where recklessness could cause injury.
Channel anxiety into motivation to complete essential survival tasks.
When overwhelmed, stop and take 5 deep breaths to regain mental clarity.
Focus on specific, achievable tasks (finding water, building shelter) rather than abstract worries.
Use realistic training experience to build confidence and manage fears.
Convert 'what if' thoughts into 'what will I do when' planning.
warnings: Fear can immobilize you and prevent essential survival activities.
Overwhelming anxiety causes confusion and poor judgment.
Uncontrolled fear can make you react to imagination rather than reality.
